Package net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence

This package contains the Equivalence interface central to the library, as well as some of the basic implementations used when creating equivalences from annotation-driven specification interfaces.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Equivalence<T> This interface defines a relation over a type, computed and described with hamcrest matchers.
 

Class Summary
ApproximateEqualityEquivalence The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence on anynumeric type as close equality up to a given tolerance.
ArrayEquivalences ArrayEquivalences allows to adapt an equivalence on a given type into an equivalence that acts upon arrays of that type.
EqualityEquivalence<U> The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality by equals().
IdentityEquivalence<U> The IdentityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality by ==.
IterableEquivalence<T> IterableEquivalence is an equivalence that acts upon Iterables of a type given an equivalence on the component type.
LiftedEquivalence<T,U> LiftedEquivalence allows to extend an equivalence acting upon a type U to anoter type T using a function of T into U.
TextEquivalence The EqualityEquivalence class defines equivalence as equality on Strings starting with strict equality that can be relaxed by a number of options defined by the TextEquivalenceOption enum.
 

Enum Summary
TextEquivalenceOption The options for TextEquivalence.
 

Package net.chwthewke.hamcrest.equivalence Description

This package contains the Equivalence interface central to the library, as well as some of the basic implementations used when creating equivalences from annotation-driven specification interfaces.
